Reviews.Title: “Substandard accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Perpetual J
Reviews.Content: This is a 'tired' looking hotel. First impressions of my room were the musky smell and mouldy bathroom. The sheets were not fully changed on my double bed; I was given a single sheet instead of a double and only noticed this when I got into my bed! The location is a good point and the staff in general were pleasant. Breakfast was of a very poor quality. The idli were not of the correct consistency. The breakfast room is crowded and often it was impossible to get a table. I understand the hotel is being refurbished. I will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, courteous staff, not good enough facilities”
Reviews.Author: ketss
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed in Hotel Seashell inn 5th to 9th of Dec 2011. The hotel is centrally located in Bur dubai with close proximity to shopping areas, metro station, and bus stations. There are good restaurants nearby. There is Carrefour nearby. Breakfast was really good with good variety. The staff in the hotel is courteous. Although they served complimentary drinking water bottles only on the first day. We had to pay extra for the extra bottles used. When we pay for 4 nights, are we not entitled to complimentary bottles on all these days? The bath tub was leaking. We even found cockroaches in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: akvalluri
Reviews.Content: If you are on a short 3-4 day vacation to Dubai and cannot survive without Indian food then this the Hotel to stay for you. The USP of the Hotel is its proximity to all Indian Restaurants in Bur Dubai. The Hotel is clean and the staff are prompt and helpful, but to call it a 3-star is far fetched. The Breakfast menu , though adeqaute , is not elaborate enough for a 3-star. They served one Indian item, one choice of fruit and eggs to order. The rooms are not spacious enough for a 3-star and a tea/coffee maker is a glaring miss !

Reviews.Title: “Just like any other above average 3-star hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Charu0017
Reviews.Content: Sea Shell Inn is just like any other above average 3-star hotel. I stayed here for almost a week.The staff is not very hospitable. In spite of making a booking in advance, I was standing lost outside the airport with no hotel-cab to receive me. I had to finally take a taxi to the hotel which was just a 15min drive. Later on the hotel manager agreed to reimburse the amount from my bill. The buffet breakfast is excellent. However the cuisine is limited. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location is good. It is walking distance from Meena bazaar & the electronic goods market.The metro station is only a 15 min walk away. There was no bar or discotheque as advertised. Again, on my way back, I was not provided any transportation till the airport because I was 5 min late & the receptionist had no interest either to make alternate arrangements. It is recommended only if you need a place to spend the night along with breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “my worst days in seashell inn”
Reviews.Author: Mukesh656
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there twice I can't say I was looking forward to the third time. Fortunately for me my company change my booking and moved me to another hotel. Finally I was able to enjoy my stay in Dubai. The location is good, but the hotel itself is bad. Really bad! Non-smoking room are not really non-smoking, they just remove the ash tray. They don't even bother with trying to hide the smell. There is bad smell in the whole hotel. Don't try the food there. I think it is one of the worst I've ever tried. The sirloin ordered turned out to be something way different cheaper meat... but the price remained. The rooms are old and worn out. The beds are clean and general cleanliness is ok. The staff is ok, but they don't speak good English. They are not very accommodating when it comes to complaints. If you are looking for a pleasant stay in Dubai I can't recommend this hotel. If you are just looking for a bed to spend the night in, I guess this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great Value For Money, But...”
Reviews.Author: PRO69
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Seashell Inn. The buffet breakfast and lunch are still excellent and great value for money. The staff were just as charming and helpful as before. The rooms were just as clean and comfortable as they were on our last visit. The price had not changed in the last year and for us this is an important detail. However, there are a couple of things that travellers should be aware of. Firstly, the hotel is advertised as having a bar and a nightclub. For various reasons they are no longer available. This was a bit annoying to us as, although we are not big drinkers, we do like a nightcap before going to bed. We feel that the unavailability of these features should be reflected in the advertising. We feel that in this instance the advertising is misleading! Secondly, hot water… or lack thereof! On our last visit there was a general lack of hot water. It was barely warm enough for a wash and certainly not hot enough for either a decent bath or shower. We reported this at the time and the water temperature did seem to go up a little. On this visit things had not changed! Despite reporting this three times it did not improve. At the third complaint we were told that the water was on a solar panel heating system and that if we wanted hot water we should bathe or shower between 10:00 and 11:00!!! This is just not acceptable. Who, when on a City break holiday, is in the hotel at these times? We were in Dubai to see the sights and wanted a shower/bath in the evening when we came in dirty from a day’s sightseeing around the city!!! At the end of the day, would we go back to this hotel? Certainly! Even with the lack of a bar and decent hot water it is still a good little hotel and still great value for money. Also for us the staff are fantastic and still try their best to make your holiday enjoyable for you. Peter & Jean. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sea Shell Inn, Dubai, Date 12aug-15aug 2011”
Reviews.Author: Cvshal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sea Shell Inn, Dubai, Date 12aug-15aug 2011 The hotel is a good 3 star rated property in BurDubai. The location is apt for a shopaholic due to nearby shopping hub "meena bazar" and carrefour- the super market. Everything is within 10 mins walk even the metro station. Also, it is centrally located to easily reach from one end I.e. shaikh jayed road to Other I.e. Diera city centre. Also, Dubai creek is nearby. Rooms are neat and clean. Some rooms are spacious which have double bed while some are smaller ones with 2 single beds. Rooms are fitted with color televisions and they should think about shifting to LCDs. The room service is good and in-house restaurant is like-able for Indian  community in terms of taste though food is costly in mostly all the restaurants. The hotel is well maintained but waiting area at the entrance is small and seems insufficient when a group of people arrive. Yet the people at reception are very cooperative and efficient in their working. They help in arranging public transport for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Moneys worth.”
Reviews.Author: thetravellinglunatic
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, we asked for a top floor room to avoid the noisy club downstairs and timidly looked at the sheets and smells. Fortunately, it was quiet and clean. The hotel has an Indian subcontinental feel as many of the staff and guest are from India. But that should not bother you except when a huge package tour fills the lobby during checkin and checkout. The internet did not work but we got a webcafe across the street for a fraction of what the hotel was charging. No pool and limited food options. But definately a good stay at the price. Very central location. A note of warning though, If you are looking to walk to Khalid bin Waleed metro station, as we thought would be possible, its a difficult task and you may have to get a hotel nearer to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: MilindSurve
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 04 Nights at this hotel, Every part of our stay was just perfect. Main pluspoint of this hotel is it location, Metro station is near, local market is just beside the hotel, Easy access to indian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Seashell inn,Dubai's biggest plus point is its location”
Reviews.Author: MohanR11
Reviews.Content: Seashell Inn, Dubai : Date 11 Feb. to 14 Feb. 2011 My first visit to Dubai, I was interested in staying in the centre of Bur Dubai. I got Seashell Inn. The hotel is about 25 minutes drive away from the Dubai airport. one of the first things that a budget traveller looks for in Dubai is to reduce cost of transportation since cabs are expensive. Seashell inn, Dubai's biggest plus point is its location. Being ideally located also adds to the sense of security at any time of the day or night. Its location is its best advantage. The hotel is close to heritage sites, Dubai Museium, Meena Bazar, the Dubai creek and world Trade cewntre are as easily accessed. The lobby of hotel is medium size. Hotel entrance is on main road, so there is good parking for vehicles & large Bus also. Guests can easily check in & check out from hotel to vehicle & vehicle to hotel. Cabs & public transport are easily available from the hotel. Waiting area is well-maintained. Rooms are fitted with necessities including color televisions. The television has mostly local channels with english and Hindi channels also. Rooms are clean, pleasant place to stay in the centre of Bur Dubai. Restaurent is good and offer good quality indian food and offer value for money. In short, The hotel has a lot to recomend it. It is a clean property, and it holds the price advantage. The food is reasonable and the furnishings are pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Food”
Reviews.Author: ahuja365
Reviews.Content: I was here on a work tour and the location and free parking were add ons.The Indian food is amazing and there is round the clock room service available.There is also so called indian club where girls dance on indian songs.I did not enjoy that coz it is not my taste.There is also a pub where you can play pool.

Reviews.Title: “VFM Option”
Reviews.Author: earth69
Reviews.Content: When I checked in to the hotel,I found many Indian travellers in the Hotel area and realised that most of the tour operaters offer rooms here from India. Which was actually good in a way cos the breakfast suited my family's Indian taste pallete. Rooms are good AC, althought old style and have some need to contemporarise. Service standards are good, polite & helpful staff. Location is quite convinient. Was here for 3 nights comfortabley.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money but Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Happytravellerman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seashell for 4 nights during April. The reception area is basic but functional and the desk staff efficient and polite. My luggage was taken to my room by a very friendly bell-boy who explained all the features of the room to me. The Standard Room I requested was cutting-edge fashion in the mid-80s but is in serious need of a revamp. The bed was comfortable but the bedding should be burned as an act of mercy for future guests. The sheets were stained by what I hope was food and weren't quite big enough for the mattress size. I had them exchanged and was more satisfied with the less-old ones. Similarly the towels were appalling. I have a better towel at home I use to dry my dog with after he's been washed. WiFi Internet is available in the rooms for a charge. It's not very good but will suffice. There is a personal safe available in the staff office behind the reception desk which is too small for a laptop but more than adequate for all other valuables. The safe requires 2 keys to function, one which you hold and the other kept by the hotel. I tested the principle and it is fine. You have 24hr availability for access. Within the hotel there is Johnnies Bar in the foyer which is loosely based on the idea of a British pub/sports bar. It reeks of smoke but is fine for the occasional drink before going elsewhere. There is also an Indian restaurant and a nightclub on the ground floor so I recommend you request a room on the 5th or 6th floor if you want to sleep before 3am. Breakfast is served in the dining room on the mezzenine floor and is ideal for the non-european guests. I'm not a fussy eater but couldn't face Indian food for breakfast so had to settle for a bowl of cornflakes and some toast each day. The dining facility is available 24 hrs a day apparently and I did have lunch there twice and enjoyed both meals. The Seashell is staffed by Indians and caters for an almost all Indian guest list. This is perfectly acceptable and although I am not Indian I was made to feel welcome by all members of staff. For a good, reasonably priced hotel, the Seashell ticks all the boxes. It would score higher points if those bed sheets and the towels were replaced though.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rohitashgupta
Reviews.Content: We booked via cox and kings for all inclusive package. Did not try food at the hotel but in general hotel room was big and comfortable. Bathroom had water logging problem and hotel is 2 KM from nearest metro. Has decent inexpensive food joints nearby, has small and big supermarkets at nearby distance. Overall good value for money if you plan to do city tour on your own or thru tour operator.

Reviews.Title: “An Average three star with many facilities and known landmark itself”
Reviews.Author: ashishindani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to metro station, dock, malls etc. Its nightlife is famous in Dubai. Has good qaulity of premium restaurents. The Breakfast and evening events are cool. you can find markets like Mina bazar close by.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for women travelers”
Reviews.Author: eaw007
Reviews.Content: Location: The Seashell is 3 blocks from the bus station (for buses to Abu Dhabi), a 15 minute walk from the Khalid Bin Al Waleed metro stop (which can take you to the "new" Dubai areas), and a 10 minute walk from the souks, the creek, and Deira. Atmosphere: The hotel is run by Indian staff and is largely occupied by Indian tourists and families. It feels safe and comfortable and interacting with staff is very easy. The breakfast is great and includes Indian dhosa, sambar and tea. As a well-traveled young-professional woman I would recommend this hotel to other women who like to be active and adventurous while having a safe place to return to. Dubai as a city is not necessaryily that unsafe, but the cultural restrictions on women are noticeable. I booked the hotel online and with breakfast, service fees, and 1 hour of internet (10AED) included my nightly charge was 250 AED.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller3
Reviews.Content: Thought I should review this hotel before I forget much of what I wanted to say, so here goes. Date of stay - Christmastime 2010 SUMMARY : The hotel itself is nice enough, the staff are friendly, the location is fantastic if you need to take public transport and want to be near the shops. However, the standard of cleanliness and the maintenance of the bathrooms need to be reviewed ASAP as they let down the rest of the hotel. Other people have mentioned noise from the nightclub, however we did not hear any noise, except for traffic flow. Possibly the nightclub was closed in December?? 1. THE PROS : A - LOCATION : The location is probably the biggest "pro" of this hotel. It is close to the market area with shops, restaurants, bus station hub, abras etc. We chose it for this reason as we hadn't planned on hiring a car. Because the major bus hub (Al Ghubaiba) is just a 5 minute walk away from the hotel, a number of bus routes all pass by the hotel. There are also plenty of taxis passing by, and the metro station is a short distance away. The staff were friendly. The check-in process was no different to any other 3 star hotel, but the return of the passports took longer than we would have liked. B - BEDROOMS : Has both Pros as well as Cons - The bedroom was of a good size and was tastefully decorated with sheer curtains for daytime privacy and lovely red and gold curtains for evening and nighttime privacy. There is a mini-bar which is stocked, and the usual desk and sofas. There were only two pillows and no spares in the cupboard as one would expect from a hotel of its class. Nor was there a private safe, which is usual for a 3-star property. We ended up carrying our stuff with us as using a common hotel safe in the reception is hardly private. However, the closet space was large with shelves and hanging area. This is much better than the Accor Group who tend to cater more for the one or two night business traveller and provide little or no shelving. C - Private Parking : The hotel has parking in its basement, so this is very useful when deciding which hotel to book, especially in Dubai where there is literally no where you can park without attracting stiff charges. 2. THE CONS : Unfortunately more than the "pros". A. Breakfast. There are two problems with breakfast - a free table and menu choice. If you are Indian you'll be fine. If you are not, well breakfast wll be a big issue. We stayed there for 8 days and had to go down for breakfast several times each morning to try to find a free table. It appears that the hotel is used for airline passengers (Air India??) who have had flight problems and as a consequence the breakfast room seems to always be full of Indian travellers. This lack of seating caused us huge problems as we were alway late getting out and about in the mornings. One morning we were supposed to drive to Ras Al Khaimah but did not reach there until almost 1pm and as a result nothing was open until 4pm. It ended up as a wasted trip for us, not just in time but in petrol. Menu choice : If you're Indian you're okay because the "hot" breakfast option is different everyday. However, menu choice if you are not Indian is very poor and boring. It's fine if you are there only for a day or two, but when out of the 8 breakfasts that we had, 6 of them were basically the same with the same chicken franks in chilli sauce, boiled egg and omlettes it becomes boring. There was cheese omlette mentioned a couple of times, but it was hard to taste any chesse in it. Not sure what type of cheese was being used. Another time "masala omlette" was mentioned but again, it tasted no different to the normal daily "plain omlette". There was french toast maybe 4 times, in addition to the egg and chicken, and this was a welcome addition. One day there was really nice french fries, but they were swiped within 5 minutes of being put onto the hotplates! As part of their Continental offering, there were danish pastry, croissants and muffins. However, the muffins were extremely dry and the pastry of the danish and the croissants were hard and not to proper standard that a European would expect from a croissant. Anyone who has ever eaten a proper croissant in France will know what I am talking about. Good quality croissant and danish are available in Dubai too so I'm not sure where the hotel is buying their product from! Besides the above there is a choice of fruit juices, cereals, fresh fruit, tea and coffee. Not a bad quantity, however the quality is more of the issue with much of it appearing to be just the same as the day before. B. BATHROOMS: The nice bedroom is let down in a big way by the bathroom! What can I say about it?? The state of repair was far worse than the 20+ year old apartment we used to rent just down the road from the Seashell Inn some years ago. The grouting is dirty, ranging from grey to black mouldy bits in some areas. It gave one a feeling of dirtiness to see the mould on the grouting and discolouration on the corners. On the wall near the floor was a long black hair where it had stuck to the wall by whoever had mopped the floor. This black hair was there the day we checked in and still there the day we checked out! This tells me that supervision of the cleaners is poor and cleaning standards are even poorer. The tiling is dated and old fashioned. The wall behind the toilet tank had several different colours and pattern of tiles, pink, grey etc., obviously due to plumbing problems at different times over the years. No attempt at matching the original tiles had ever been made, simply patching it up with whatever was available to hand. This is unacceptable in a 3 star property. I wouldn't even do it in my own home, let alone expect it in an hotel. The entire bathroom needs to be ripped out and re-decorated to a proper standard. C - WATER FOR BATHING : The bathroom has a bathtub, however there is no hot water to fill it. The temperature of the hot water tap was TEPID at best. Some times of the day there is NO hot water, leaving one shivering through the shower. Again this is inexcusable and unacceptable. If the boiler is not large enough to cater for all guests at any time of the day, then they need to address this issue and put in additional boilers. D - TRAVEL DESK : There is a travel desk run by some third party, where you can make bookings for tours etc. This is convenient for tour booking, however when it comes to vehicle hire, they are not running this themselves. We hired a vehicle through them and ended up paying at least 20% more. Nor is it really convenient since the vehicle is NOT available at the hotel, but you have to go to the actual car hire company's offices to do the paperwork and pick up the car. We could have gone directly to the car hire company ourselves and got a much lower rate than we ended up paying. There are loads of car hire companies in Karama, so unless you are in a hurry and do not want to check out what's available I would recommend that you do not use the travel desk.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel & Staff Made Our Holiday A Success”
Reviews.Author: PRO69
Reviews.Content: The Seashell Inn was recommended to us by a friend. We went on line and booked through “booking.com”. The booking on line was easy and when our dates had to be changed they did this for us within a couple of hours and without any fuss. We emailed the hotel to request an airport pickup and drop off and also to ask for a room on a high floor. Reading on TA we had noticed reports that the nightclub was a bit noisy. The hotel came back to us within 8 hours to confirm the pickup (@ 60dhs or $16.30 each way). They also said that an upper floor room would be provided if possible. Whilst travelling around in Taxis later, we were able to work out that 60dhs was a very fair price! On our arrival in Dubai we asked where to get our free entry visa and were told that it was not necessary as we were only staying four nights. The rest of the entry procedure was simple. Our driver, Abdul, was waiting for us with a large printed sign with our name on it and we were quickly installed in a cool, clean mini bus and on our way through the traffic. After about 25 minutes we pulled up at the Seashell Inn to be greeted with smiling faces. The bell hop quickly had our cases inside and reception was waiting for us with more friendly smiling faces. A quick check in and we were shown to our room on the 5th floor. The room was of an average size, well decorated and furnished and spotlessly clean. There was ample wardrobe and draw space. We had an en-suite bathroom with a large, deep bath with shower over. There were toiletries (bath gel, shampoo, soap and shower cap) on a shelf above the hand basin. These were replaced every day as where the towels. The bed sheets were replaced after only 2 nights. On opening the bedroom curtains I noticed that the inside of the large window had a couple of marks, which had been caused by someone leaning their head against the glass. However, a quick call to reception had “housekeeping” cleaning the windows whilst we went for lunch. We had one other minor problem; the water in the bathroom was only barely warm; once again a quick call to reception sorted that out. THE COFFEE SHOP As we had arrived about lunchtime we decided to try the 24 hour coffee shop. There was an Asian buffet and an al a carte menu. The buffet had a salad starter, several Indian dishes meat and vegetarian, a dhal, a couple of rice dishes, bread and a desert. I found out that the dishes were different each day. I tried this buffet and it was excellent. In fact it was so good we ate lunch there a second time two days later... I do love my Indian food! At 35dhs ($9.50) for as much as you can eat, it was very good value for money. Jean opted for the menu and had a large chicken sandwich one day and a Hawaiian salad on the other. She said that both were well made, moist and tasty. Breakfast, which was included in our room price of 250dhs ($68) per night, was also more than adequate. There was cereal, fruit, salad, cold meats and cheeses, sweet pastries and sliced bread (brown & white) to self toast on a rotary toaster. The buffet dishes changed every day and contained such items as porridge, chicken sausages, baked beans, potatoes, boiled eggs and a couple of Indian items such as upma and dosa. On top of this one could order eggs cooked as required. We had scrambled on the first morning and there was more than enough for three people. When we ordered 2 fried and 2 poached eggs the next day we received 4 eggs each. A portion being 2! All were cooked to perfection, soft, just as we had ordered. The hotel its self is in a good location to reach the various tourist sites. There is a Metro station just a short (10dhs) taxi ride or a ten minute walk away. The road the hotel is in has many shops including several computer shops. There are also a few small restaurants. It is also about a ten minute walk to the creek where you can pick up a water taxi (1dh) and cross over to the other side which is very cosmopolitan and where there are a lot of cheaper shops. The hotel has a small “sports” bar and a night club. We visited the bar on a couple of evenings and found it pleasant and reasonably priced. We did not visit the night club but heard it up to about the third floor!!! The internet was Wi-Fi at a cost of 10dhs per hour. Collect the code from reception. All in all this was an excellent hotel for the money, made more so by the staff, that were on all occasions, polite, courteous, cheerful and very well trained. If you wish to ask for more info please PM me. Peter & Jean. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Basic hotel in old Dubai”
Reviews.Author: traveldreamer61
Reviews.Content: Very large rooms, clean and comfortable in old Dubai. Good breakfasts, menu changed daily with a range of hot and cold food. Walking distance to the Dubai museum. Staff in main resturant lovely, happy to accommodate guest food tastes.

Reviews.Title: “a very comfortable and good valued Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gurcan
Reviews.Content: I spend round 8 days in this Hotel. The rooms are very clean and services like business center, room service, laundry, etc perfect and stuff knows to smile. unfortunately it was a bit far to my business friends but very closed to centre of Bur Dubai, bus station and Taxis are always awailable. I really enjoyed my stay in Seashell inn Hotel and definitaly come again. Gurcan Pehlivan, Germany gp@biobuilding.de

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AkhileshIndia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days and our stay was excellent... People at reception and at travel desk were very helping and nice. Breakfast is good. We just enjoyed our stay at Seashell Inn...

Reviews.Title: “Transit”
Reviews.Author: AdnanFida
Reviews.Content: I 've stayed two nights in Seashell inn, Nice hotel for transit, walking distance to IT market, there is goood bollywood bar on ground floor. only thing is when ever you come ask for room on 4,5,6 floor, coze till 3AM you can hear disco on 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: ang1357
Reviews.Content: Please don't book this hotel. My mother and I arrived on an early flight and got to the hotel at about 8 am, we were kept waiting in the lobby for hours until a room was ready - no coffee offered - nothing. After a very long flight, we were so tired. Our bill was never correct -- thaey are constantly trying to rip you off. We were told to pay for their mistake on and incorrect bill because "the people are very poor here and cant afford to pay for their mistake, we would really appreciate it if you paid the difference" WHAt? THIS HOTEL IS A JOKE - Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ArcherReykjavik
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there twice I can't say I was looking forward to the third time. Fortunately for me my company change my booking and moved me to another hotel. Finally I was able to enjoy my stay in Dubai. The location is good, but the hotel itself is bad. Really bad! Non-smoking room are not really non-smoking, they just remove the ash tray. They don't even bother with trying to hide the smell. There is bad smell in the whole hotel. Don't try the food there. I think it is one of the worst I've ever tried. The sirloin ordered turned out to be something way different cheaper meat... but the price remained. The rooms are old and worn out. The beds are clean and general cleanliness is ok. The staff is ok, but they don't speak good English. They are not very accommodating when it comes to complaints. If you are looking for a pleasant stay in Dubai I can't recommend this hotel. If you are just looking for a bed to spend the night in, I guess this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again here”
Reviews.Author: W0lverine
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews and taking on board all the negative comments I booked this hotel for 2 families of 4 each. Considering the night club and the noise we requested 3 room on the 3rd floor or above, all no smoking rooms. Upon arrival and checking in we were informed by the non-helpful receptionist that there were no requests made for all 3 room on the 3rd floor or above, all no smoking rooms, and we were given one room on 4th floor - no smokng and 2 rooms in 1st floor both SMOKING. I showed them my copy of the booking confirmation specifically requesting all 3 room on the 3rd floor or above, all no smoking rooms but they insisted no requests were made. I had proof on paper but they still didn't want to know. Not a good start to the holiday. They did say that if any rooms on the 3rd floor or above did become available we would be shifted. During the first night, in one of the rooms on the 1st floor we saw cockroaches and we immediately informed the hotel that this is not acceptable. They fumigated the room and this went on for 4 days. We see cockroaches and they spray. At no time did they shift us despite our pleas that at the very least we expect an insect free room. On the 5th day we were finally moved from the cockroach room to another room on the 3rd floor. But it was too little too late as we only had 2 nights left before we flew back to the UK. Despite that Bur Dubai as a great location and leaving the hotel aside we did enjoy Dubai. But I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would never recommend”
Reviews.Author: johnbanafsag
Reviews.Content: WARNING: DO NOT make long distance phone calls from this hotel or you will find your phone bill more than your room bill. Without question, one of my worst online bookings. Room was small with no drawers for clothes. The . . . uh . . . view - nothing more than than dirty windows and clothes hanging on clotheslines staring back at you. Virtually nothing around the hotel within walking distance except computer store after computer store. Although the very nice Burjman Mall is just a short cab ride away. Small but nice enough dining area. Very limited breakfast buffet. Staff. Helpful but seemingly disinterested. As others have said, it is very noisy unless you are on the upper floors and facing away from the city street.. Even at the discounted online rate, this hotel was still overpriced by about 20%. Final analysis. I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Xtrem123
Reviews.Content: The rooms faceing the street are just above a night club and the music doesn't stop until 3am. VERY LOUND music on first 3 floors. Thin windows that wakes you as soon as the traffic starts. The complete staff is very rude. Front desk is worst. No service at all. lost our booking but when my travel agent called they "just found them"

Reviews.Title: “very damp”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the air was extremely damp due to an obsolete air condition. The breakfast was one of the worst buffets I've ever seen (and I've travelled around the world). For 2-3 days it's bearable but not any longer.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for a transit stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel while in transit to Dubai and also love night clubs, this is one hotel which fits the bill. First and foremost, ask for a room from 3rd floor upwards, if u prefer a sound sleep after a drink or two and donot like the clubbing thumps/vibes in your rooms. The sports bar on the ground level is a nice,small,decent place even if you have female guests.the filipino hostesses are very friendly with their ever charming innocent smile on their faces ( they very well deserve a good tip )Ask for the kebabs and chicken lollipops if you love fried stuff...its just wonderful. you might also get a Beer t-shirt/cap or two ( provided the promos are going on) if you can manage to coax the fnb manager by the name Michael(indian),a friendly chap. ( he prefers Red bull with Vodka )..!!! breakfast is acceptable and room service/house keeping exteremly good and prompt if you tip the attendant. !! Overall, a nice,affordable,small,quiet place ( 3rd floor plus)with convenient access to all places of interest

Reviews.Title: “January stay fine for viewing the marathon runners.”
Reviews.Author: MissNancy50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Seashell Inn in early January. We had the Executive room, which was very spacious and modern, with a king size bed , though it was a bit clammy and damp. The wrap-around windows were nice. The kids had a regular room which was, regular - with two twin beds. We had paid for breakfast, which was okay, with a selection of English, Arabic, and Indian dishes in a buffet. The hotel is located on a main road in the heart of the computer souk. It was on the route of the Dubai Marathon which we had come to view. The main complaint about the hotel is the nightclub and loud music. We were on the third (European) floor and the nightclub was on the ground floor below us. The sound was very loud until 3 am both nights. Service was fine and the staff was friendly. There was an airport shuttle - apparently this is a hotel used by many who are just stopping over between flights. We had rented a car - the parking is in the basement in a tiny parking garage. Don't try to get a suburban in there! The hotel was fine for a short stay, but I think for a longer stay, one on the beach would be nicer.

HotelInfo.Name: Seashell Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Khalid Bin Al Waleed Str | P.O. Box 20715, Dubai 101, United Arab Emirates
